intro: Erigeron scaturicola, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron scaturicola is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
